content: Which of the following statements is CORRECT regarding the TCP Tahoe congestion handling mechanism?
options: When an anomaly occurs, set the cwnd size to 1.
When an anomaly occurs, reduce the cwnd size by half.
After congestion, recover cwnd to the ssthresh threshold.
answer: When an anomaly occurs, set the cwnd size to 1.

content: Select a distinct difference between the Slotted ALOHA mechanism and Token passing.
options: The mechanism is implemented fully distributed without a common coordinating node.
When a node transmits data, that node occupies the entire transmission line.
When there are M nodes needing to transmit data, each node occupies approximately a 1/M ratio of the transmission line.
All statements A, B, and C are incorrect.
answer: When there are M nodes needing to transmit data, each node occupies approximately a 1/M ratio of the transmission line.

content: Which statement BEST describes the difference between the network edge and the network core?

The edge is primarily concerned with security, while the core is concerned with transmission performance.

answer: Control data transmission between two processes on the network

content: What happens when computer A sends a broadcast (ARP request) for the MAC address of computer B on the same network?

All computers receive the request and all will reply to A
All computers receive the request but only B answers A
Nearest Router answers A or forwards the request
answer: All computers receive the request but only B answers A

content: When a TCP process sends a SYNACK segment with Acknowledgement Number = 100, what does it mean?

The first byte in the data stream it sends has sequence number 100
It will send from byte 100, skipping previous bytes
It expects to receive data starting with sequence number 100
answer: It expects to receive data starting with sequence number 100

content: The process that allows a machine to automatically request an IP address from a server when connecting to the network is:
